synopsis: OpenShift Container Platform 3.10 bug fix update

content.topic: Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform release 3.10.163 is now available with updates to packages and images that fix several bugs.
content.description:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform is Red Hat's cloud computing
Kubernetes application platform solution designed for on-premise or private
cloud deployments.

This advisory contains the RPM packages for Red Hat OpenShift Container
Platform 3.10.163. See the following advisory for the container images for
this release:

https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:2510

This update fixes the following bugs: 

* When running the deploy_cluster.yml playbook during an OpenShift install, the installer would fail with an error. Now, the repo example host inventory file has been updated to include the requirement of openshift_node_group_name for hosts. (BZ#1656475)

* Previously, timezone configuration was not mounted into the control plane static pods, which led to logging timestamps not aligning with all other system logs. The host's timezone configuration is now mounted into the control plane pods. (BZ#1690557)

* If a pod using an egress IP tried to contact an external host that was not responding, the egress IP monitoring code may mistakenly have interpreted that as meaning that the node hosting the egress IP was not responding. Highly available egress IP addresses may have been switched from one node to another spuriously. Now, The monitoring code distinguishes the case of "egress node not responding" from "final destination not responding". (BZ#1732486)

All OpenShift Container Platform 3.10 users are advised to upgrade to these
updated packages and images.
content.solution:
Before applying this update, ensure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For OpenShift Container Platform 3.10 see the following documentation,
which will be updated shortly for release 3.10.163, for important
instructions on how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this
asynchronous errata update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.10/release_notes/ocp_3_10_release_notes.html

This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to use the
Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258.
